{"step_by_step_thinking": "The zygomatic arch is a bony structure of the skull that forms part of the orbit and the cheek. It is most commonly fractured at the weakest point, which is the zygomaticotemporal suture. This is because the suture is a joint between two bones, making it a point of relative weakness compared to the solid bone of the zygomatic arch.", "answer_choice": "C. Zygomaticotemporal suture"}
